awd_titl_txt: Remote Sensing of Ocean Heat Storage Based on Measurements  of Atmospheric Inert Gas Ratios
awd_abstract_narration: Abstract  ATM-9400694  Keeling, Ralph  University of California, San Diego  Title: Remote Sensing of Large-Scale Air-Sea Heat Fluxes Based on  Ultra Precise Measurements of the Atmospheric Kr/N2 Ratio    In this proposal,a method is proposed for detecting changes in the  global heat storage in the oceans, based on measuring changes in  the relative abundance of atmospheric insert gases.  The insert gas  ratios are sensitive to ocean temperature through the temperature  dependence of their solubilities in sea water.  The heavier insert  gases are preferentially released to the air as ocean warms.  The  insert gas ratios Ar/N2 and Xe/N2 are to be measured to a very high  precision for feasibility demonstration.    This idea is novel, simple and addresses a fundamental issue of  climate variability nd change.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
